item.title: Fraternity closes Rutgers chapter after hazing nearly electrocutes student
item.description: The national chapter of Alpha Sigma Phi made the announcement on Friday, saying they have closed the fraternity's chapter at Rutgers following their own investigation.

item.title: 33 indicted following FBI drug operation in Philadelphia's Kensington section
item.description: The FBI announced on Friday that 33 people have been indicted following a raid targeting the Weymouth Street Drug Trafficking Organization in the Kensington section of Philadelphia.

item.title: Spring-Ford Area High School students strike up the band
item.description: Throughout its nearly 75-year history, the Spring-Ford Area High School band has delivered a good time, and Friday was no different.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Kent

item.title: California union proposes taxing billionaires to offset Medicaid cuts
item.description: A major union announced a proposal to impose a one-time 5% tax on billionaires in California to address federal funding cuts to health care for low-income people.
item.dc:creator: AP

item.title: Painting company surprises mother of victim killed in NE Philly plane crash

item.title: Transportation Secretary says he wants to see 'results' as SEPTA races to finish inspections
item.description: SEPTA is feeling more pressure, this time coming from the federal government.

item.media:title: Transportation Secretary warns he could force SEPTA to stop using rail car fleet due to fire risks
item.media:description: U.S. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy is warning that his department could force SEPTA to stop using a fleet of rail cars due to fire risks.

item.title: 4 million gallons flood streets after water main break in North Philadelphia
item.description: A water main break in North Philadelphia is causing major issues on Friday.
item.dc:creator: 6abc Digital Staff
item.media:title: 4 million gallons flood streets after water main break in North Philadelphia
item.media:description: A massive water main break in North Philadelphia left behind a crater in the road and flooded out cars and basements as millions of gallons of water rushed down 9th Street.

item.title: Social Security recipients get a 2.8% cost-of-living boost in 2026, average of $56 per month
item.description: The Social Security cost-of-living increase will go up by 2.8% in 2026, which translates to an average increase of more than $56 for retirees every month, agency officials said Friday.
item.dc:creator: AP
item.media:title: Social Security recipients get a 2.8% cost-of-living boost in 2026
item.media:description: The Social Security cost-of-living increase will go up by 2.8% in 2026, which translates to an average increase of more than $56 for retirees every month, agency officials said Friday.

item.title: Girl shot in Minneapolis church returns home from the hospital
item.description: A 12-year-old girl who was shot in the head during a deadly attack at a Minneapolis Catholic church in August was released from the hospital Thursday.
item.dc:creator: AP
item.category: school shooting,child injured,hospital,mass shooting,u.s. & world,child shot

item.title: The story behind declining homicides & violent crimes in Philadelphia - Inside Story 102625
item.description: Host Tamala Edwards interviews David Brown - Executive Director of the Civic Coalition to Save Lives and Adam Geer - the City of Philadelphia's Chief Public Safety Director on the recent good news of a steep decline in homicides and violent crime
item.dc:creator: Tamala Edwards

item.title: Tropical Storm Melissa stationary in the Caribbean as forecasters warn it will quickly intensify
item.description: Tropical Storm Melissa is nearly stationary in the central Caribbean, with forecasters warning it could soon strengthen and brush past Jamaica as a powerful hurricane
item.dc:creator: AP
